required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Effectiveness of Jetstream Atherectomy System (J-SUPREME II)
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Single-arm Clinical Trial of Jetstream Atherectomy System for the Treatment of Japanese Patients With Symptomatic Occlusive Atherosclerotic Lesions in the Superficial Femoral and/ or Proximal Popliteal Arteries

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the Jetstream Atherectomy System for the treatment of Japanese patients with symptomatic occlusive atherosclerotic lesions in native superficial femoral artery (SFA) and/ or proximal popliteal arteries (PPA).

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective, multicenter, single-arm trial evaluating the safety and efficacy of the Jetstream Atherectomy System in the treatment of symptomatic occlusive atherosclerotic lesions ≤150 mm in length located in the femoropopliteal arteries in subjects with symptoms classified as Rutherford categories 2-4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Distal Emboli Requiring Additional Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during procedure or within 24 hours post-index procedure

secondary_outcome.description: The difference between the percent stenosis prior to treatment with Jetstream and the percent stenosis following treatment with Jetstream.
All-cause death through 1 month, and/or target limb major amputation and/or Target Lesion Revascularization (TLR) through 6 months
Distribution of Rutherford Class as compared to baseline at 1 month and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Primary and Secondary Sustained Clinical Improvement

secondary_outcome.description: Rate of Hemodynamic Improvement as assessed by changes in Ankle-Brachial Index (ABI) as compared to baseline at 1 month and 6 months

intervention.description: A rotating, aspirating, expandable catheter system for active removal of atherosclerotic debris and thrombus in the SFA and/or PPA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic, symptomatic lower limb ischemia defined as Rutherford categories 2-4
- Stenotic, restenotic or occlusive lesion(s) located in the native SFA and/or PPA of which meet the following criteria:
- Severely calcified lesions with degree of stenosis ≥70%
- Vessel diameter ≥3.0 mm and ≤6.0 mm
- Total lesion length (or series of lesions) ≤150 mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Target lesion/vessel with in-stent restenosis
- History of major amputation in the target limb
- Subject has a history of coagulopathy or hypercoagulable bleeding disorder
- Subject with untreatable hemorrhagic disease or platelet count <80,000mm3 or >600,000mm3 as baseline assessment.
- History of myocardial infarction, or stroke/cerebrovascular accident (CVA) within 6 months prior to study enrollment
- Unstable angina pectoris at the time of the enrollment
- Septicemia at the time of enrollment
- Presence of other hemodynamically significant outflow lesions in the target limb requiring a planned surgical intervention or endovascular procedure within 30 days after the index procedure
- Presence of aneurysm in the target vessel
- Acute ischemia and/or acute thrombosis of the SFA/PPA prior to the index procedure
- Perforated vessel as evidenced by extravasation of contrast media prior to the index procedure

facility.name: Tokyo Bay Urayasu Ichikawa Medical Center

patient_data.ipd_description: The confidentiality of records/data obtained in the trial will remain anonymous for analysis and publication. The information and data, obtained from the trial is used without personal identification.
